definition[0]: a place where a large number of historical records are stored, or the records that are stored
example[0]: an archive of the writer’s unpublished work
definition[1]: copies of a computer’s files that are stored on a disk or in the computer’s memory in a way that uses less space than usual, so that the computer can keep them for a long time
definition[2]: to put documents, books, information etc in an archive
definition[3]: to save a computer file in a way that uses less space than usual, because you do not use that file often but may need it in the future
definition[4]: to make a permanent copy of information held in a computer or to store the information so that it cannot be changed or lost
example[1]: Once a month the files will be archived.
definition[5]: the part of a computer or computer system where information is stored in such a way that it cannot be changed or lost
example[2]: You could rebuild your hard disk’s contents from this archive.
